devdoc.author: Curve.Fi
devdoc.details: Asset Types: 0. Standard ERC20 token with no additional features. Note: Users are advised to do careful due-diligence on ERC20 tokens that they interact with, as this contract cannot differentiate between harmless and malicious ERC20 tokens. 1. Oracle - token with rate oracle (e.g. wstETH) Note: Oracles may be controlled externally by an EOA. Users are advised to proceed with caution. 2. Rebasing - token with rebase (e.g. stETH). Note: Users and Integrators are advised to understand how the AMM contract works with rebasing balances. 3. ERC4626 - token with convertToAssets method (e.g. sDAI). Note: Some ERC4626 implementations may be susceptible to Donation/Inflation attacks. Users are advised to proceed with caution. NOTE: Pool Cannot support tokens with multiple asset types: e.g. ERC4626 with fees are not supported. Supports: 1. ERC20 support for return True/revert, return True/False, return None 2. ERC20 tokens can have arbitrary decimals (<=18). 3. ERC20 tokens that rebase (either positive or fee on transfer) 4. ERC20 tokens that have a rate oracle (e.g. wstETH, cbETH, sDAI, etc.) Note: Oracle precision _must_ be 10**18. 5. ERC4626 tokens with arbitrary precision (<=18) of Vault token and underlying asset. Additional features include: 1. Adds price oracles based on AMM State Price (and _not_ last traded price). 2. Adds TVL oracle based on D. 3. `exchange_received`: swaps that expect an ERC20 transfer to have occurred prior to executing the swap. Note: a. If pool contains rebasing tokens and one of the `asset_types` is 2 (Rebasing) then calling `exchange_received` will REVERT. b. If pool contains rebasing token and `asset_types` does not contain 2 (Rebasing) then this is an incorrect implementation and rebases can be stolen. 4. Adds `get_dx`: Similar to `get_dy` which returns an expected output of coin[j] for given `dx` amount of coin[i], `get_dx` returns expected input of coin[i] for an output amount of coin[j]. 5. Fees are dynamic: AMM will charge a higher fee if pool depegs. This can cause very slight discrepancies between calculated fees and realised fees.

returns._0: bytes32 Domain Separator set for the current chain.

params._A: Amplification co-efficient - a lower value here means less tolerance for imbalance within the pool's assets. Suggested values include: * Uncollateralized algorithmic stablecoins: 5-10 * Non-redeemable, collateralized assets: 100 * Redeemable assets: 200-400
params._asset_types: Array of uint8 representing tokens in pool
params._coins: List of addresses of the coins being used in the pool.
params._fee: Trade fee, given as an integer with 1e10 precision. The the maximum is 1% (100000000). 50% of the fee is distributed to veCRV holders.
params._ma_exp_time: Averaging window of oracle. Set as time_in_seconds / ln(2) Example: for 10 minute EMA, _ma_exp_time is 600 / ln(2) ~= 866
params._method_ids: Array of first four bytes of the Keccak-256 hash of the function signatures of the oracle addresses that gives rate oracles. Calculated as: keccak(text=event_signature.replace(" ", ""))[:4]
params._name: Name of the new plain pool.
params._offpeg_fee_multiplier: A multiplier that determines how much to increase Fees by when assets in the AMM depeg. Example value: 20000000000
params._rate_multipliers: An array of: [10 ** (36 - _coins[n].decimals()), ... for n in range(N_COINS)]
params._symbol: Symbol for the new plain pool.

params._amounts: List of amounts of coins to deposit
params._min_mint_amount: Minimum amount of LP tokens to mint from the deposit
params._receiver: Address that owns the minted LP tokens

returns._0: Amount of LP tokens received by depositing

params._amounts: List of amounts of coins to deposit
params._min_mint_amount: Minimum amount of LP tokens to mint from the deposit
params._receiver: Address that owns the minted LP tokens

returns._0: Amount of LP tokens received by depositing

approve(address,uint256).details: Beware that changing an allowance via this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

params._spender: The address which will transfer the funds
params._value: The amount of tokens that may be transferred

params.i: Index value for the coin to query balance of

params._amounts: Amount of each coin being deposited
params._is_deposit: set True for deposits, False for withdrawals

returns._0: Expected amount of LP tokens received

params._burn_amount: Amount of LP tokens to burn in the withdrawal
params.i: Index value of the coin to withdraw
Index value for the coin to send
params.j: Index value of the coin to receive

returns._0: Swap fee expressed as an integer with 1e10 precision

exchange(int128,int128,uint256,uint256).details: Index values can be found via the `coins` public getter method

params.i: Index value for the coin to send
params.j: Index value of the coin to receive

exchange(int128,int128,uint256,uint256,a.details: Index values can be found via the `coins` public getter method

params.i: Index value for the coin to send
params.j: Index value of the coin to receive

exchange_received(int128,int128,uint256,.details: The contract swaps tokens based on a change in balance of coin[i]. The dx = ERC20(coin[i]).balanceOf(self) - self.stored_balances[i]. Users of this method are dex aggregators, arbitrageurs, or other users who do not wish to grant approvals to the contract: they would instead send tokens directly to the contract and call `exchange_received`. Note: This is disabled if pool contains rebasing tokens.

params.i: Index value for the coin to send
params.j: Index value of the coin to receive

exchange_received(int128,int128,uint256,.details: The contract swaps tokens based on a change in balance of coin[i]. The dx = ERC20(coin[i]).balanceOf(self) - self.stored_balances[i]. Users of this method are dex aggregators, arbitrageurs, or other users who do not wish to grant approvals to the contract: they would instead send tokens directly to the contract and call `exchange_received`. Note: This is disabled if pool contains rebasing tokens.

params.i: Index value for the coin to send
params.j: Index value of the coin to receive

get_dx(int128,int128,uint256).details: Index values can be found via the `coins` public getter method

params.dy: Amount of `j` being received after exchange
params.i: Index value for the coin to send
params.j: Index value of the coin to receive

get_dy(int128,int128,uint256).details: Index values can be found via the `coins` public getter method

params.i: Index value for the coin to send
params.j: Index value of the coin to receive

get_p(uint256).details: if i = 0, it will return the state price of coin[1].

params.i: index of state price (0 for coin[1], 1 for coin[2], ...)

returns._0: uint256 The state price quoted by the AMM for coin[i+1]

get_virtual_price().details: Useful for calculating profits. The method may be vulnerable to donation-style attacks if implementation contains rebasing tokens. For integrators, caution is advised.

returns._0: LP token virtual price normalized to 1e18

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.details: Supports smart contract wallets which implement ERC1271 https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1271

params._deadline: The timestamp after which the Permit is no longer valid.
params._owner: The address which is a source of funds and has signed the Permit.
params._r: The bytes[0:32] of the valid secp256k1 signature of permit by owner
params._s: The bytes[32:64] of the valid secp256k1 signature of permit by owner
params._spender: The address which is allowed to spend the funds.
params._v: The bytes[64] of the valid secp256k1 signature of permit by owner
params._value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Transfer token for a specified address

devdoc.title: CurveStableSwapNG

approve(address,uint256).notice: Approve the passed address to transfer the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender

balances(uint256).notice: Get the current balance of a coin within the pool, less the accrued admin fees

calc_token_amount(uint256[],bool).notice: Calculate addition or reduction in token supply from a deposit or withdrawal

calc_withdraw_one_coin(uint256,int128).notice: Calculate the amount received when withdrawing a single coin

dynamic_fee(int128,int128).notice: Return the fee for swapping between `i` and `j`

exchange(int128,int128,uint256,uint256).notice: Perform an exchange between two coins

exchange_received(int128,int128,uint256,.notice: Perform an exchange between two coins without transferring token in

get_dx(int128,int128,uint256).notice: Calculate the current input dx given output dy

get_dy(int128,int128,uint256).notice: Calculate the current output dy given input dx

get_p(uint256).notice: Returns the AMM State price of token

get_virtual_price().notice: The current virtual price of the pool LP token

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.notice: Approves spender by owner's signature to expend owner's tokens. See https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2612.

remove_liquidity_imbalance(uint256[],uin.notice: Withdraw coins from the pool in an imbalanced amount

remove_liquidity_one_coin(uint256,int128.notice: Withdraw a single coin from the pool

set_ma_exp_time(uint256,uint256).notice: Set the moving average window of the price oracles.

totalSupply().notice: The total supply of pool LP tokens

withdraw_admin_fees().notice: Claim admin fees. Callable by anyone.

userdoc.notice: Stableswap implementation for up to 8 coins with no rehypothecation, i.e. the AMM does not deposit tokens into other contracts. The Pool contract also records exponential moving averages for coins relative to coin 0.
